metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Git GUI Clients
Why use a GUI client?
Git GUI clients let you use Git with buttons and menus instead of typing commands.
content.html: Git GUI clients let you use Git with buttons and menus instead of typing commands.

content.text: They are great for beginners, make it easier to see what's happening, and help you avoid common mistakes.
content.html: They are great for beginners, make it easier to see what's happening, and help you avoid common mistakes.

content.text: Popular Git GUI Clients
GitHub Desktop
GitHub Desktop is a free, beginner-friendly app for Windows and Mac.
content.html: GitHub Desktop is a free, beginner-friendly app for Windows and Mac.

content.text: It works best with GitHub, but you can use it with other repositories too.
content.html: It works best with GitHub, but you can use it with other repositories too.

content.code:
1. Clone a repository from GitHub
2. Make changes to files
3. See changes in the app
4. Stage and commit with a message
5. Push to GitHub with one click
content.code_html:
1. Clone a repository from GitHub
2. Make changes to files
3. See changes in the app
4. Stage and commit with a message
5. Push to GitHub with one click

content.text: GitKraken
GitKraken is a powerful, cross-platform Git client with a modern interface.
content.html: GitKraken is a powerful, cross-platform Git client with a modern interface.

content.text: It supports GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and more.
content.html: It supports GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, and more.

content.code:
1. Open a repository
2. Drag and drop to create branches
3. View history and merge visually
4. Resolve conflicts with built-in tools
5. Push changes to remote
content.code_html:
1. Open a repository
2. Drag and drop to create branches
3. View history and merge visually
4. Resolve conflicts with built-in tools
5. Push changes to remote

content.text: Sourcetree
Sourcetree is a free Git client from Atlassian, popular for Bitbucket but works with any Git repository.
content.html: Sourcetree is a free Git client from Atlassian, popular for Bitbucket but works with any Git repository.

content.code:
1. Add a repository
2. Stage and commit changes
3. Use the log/history view to see all commits
4. Push and pull with buttons
content.code_html:
1. Add a repository
2. Stage and commit changes
3. Use the log/history view to see all commits
4. Push and pull with buttons

content.text: Git GUI
Git GUI is a basic graphical tool that comes with Git for Windows.
content.html: Git GUI is a basic graphical tool that comes with Git for Windows.

content.text: It's simple, but covers the basics.

content.code:
1. Open Git GUI from the Start menu
2. Select your repository folder
3. Stage files, write a commit message, and commit
4. Push to remote using the menu
content.code_html:
1. Open Git GUI from the Start menu
2. Select your repository folder
3. Stage files, write a commit message, and commit
4. Push to remote using the menu

content.text: VS Code Git
Visual Studio Code has built-in Git support.
content.html: Visual Studio Code has built-in Git support.

content.text: You can use the Source Control panel to stage, commit, push, pull, and resolve conflicts—all inside your code editor.
content.html: You can use the Source Control panel to stage, commit, push, pull, and resolve conflicts—all inside your code editor.

content.code:
1. Open a folder in VS Code
2. Make changes to files
3. Use the Source Control panel to stage and commit
4. Push and pull with buttons
content.code_html:
1. Open a folder in VS Code
2. Make changes to files
3. Use the Source Control panel to stage and commit
4. Push and pull with buttons

content.text: Other Clients
There are many other Git GUI clients, including:
content.html: There are many other Git GUI clients, including:

content.text: Most work in similar ways: you open a repo, see your changes, and use buttons for Git actions.
content.html: Most work in similar ways: you open a repo, see your changes, and use buttons for Git actions.

content.text: Troubleshooting
